newsitem.title: MAURITIUS: Mauritius rupee firms on dollar and pound.
newsitem.headline: Mauritius rupee firms on dollar and pound.

text.p: The Mauritius rupee strengthened against both the dollar and the pound on Friday, reflecting a combination of overnight international trends and central bank intervention on Wednesday, forex dealers said.
The rupee was fixed at a mean commercial rate of 20.0610 against the dollar from 20.1285 on Wednesday. The rupee traded at a mean of 32.6750 to the pound from 33.4835 on Wednesday.
Banks in Mauritius were closed on Thursday because of a public holiday.
Forex dealers said the stronger rupee was the result of a weakening dollar in overnight markets and the central bank on Wednesday selling the currency five cents below the prevailing interbank rate.
"If there was no intervention, the rupee would have appreciated by only three cents against the dollar today (Friday)," one dealer said.
